newsitem.title: USA: Christopher tops Baker's diplomatic travel record.
newsitem.headline: Christopher tops Baker's diplomatic travel record.

text.p: Secretary of State Warren Christopher on Wednesday eclipsed his predecessor James Baker in a crucial area: the distance flown in a four-year term as the United States' top diplomat.

On the completion of a flight from Bamako, Mali, to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, Christopher had flown 704,487 miles (1.134 million km) since taking office in January 1993, State Department spokesman Nicholas Burns said at a briefing.
Baker travelled 700,131 miles (1.127 million km), but he stepped down as secretary of State before his term was up to manage then-President George Bush's re-election campaign.
The all-time record, over six years, is still held by George Shultz, who had the job during the Reagan administration. He flew a total of 900,000 miles (1.448 million km).
Christopher celebrated in-flight with a cake, shared with his Air Force crew and others on the plane, Burns said.
